name: Smoky Pico de Gallo
author: Joel
summary: This is not a super-quick recipe - this is a 'slow down and enjoy making a great, smoky salsa your family and friends will love' recipe. But the pico de gallo is very easy to make. I used a food smoker to get the smoke flavoring.
ingredients: 6 cloves garlic, peeled and finely chopped
2  fresh limes, juiced, with pulp reserved
directions: Preheat a smoker grill for 200 degrees F (95 degrees C)
Add water to the bowl and wood chips to the side tray according to manufacturer's directions
Place onion, jalapeno peppers, habanero peppers, and garlic in an aluminum roasting pan small enough to fit into your smoker
Drizzle with olive oil, stirring to completely cover
Place the roasting pan into the preheated smoker
Smoke, using 1 to 2 pans of wood chips, until vegetables are tender but not dried out, about 1 to 2 hours
Meanwhile, place tomatoes in a large glass bowl
Add cilantro, lime juice, lime pulp, cumin, and seasoned salt
Mix to combine, cover, and refrigerate
Add smoked vegetables to the tomato mixture, stir to combine, and return to refrigerator to marinate for at least 30 minutes
